sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using Cholesky decomposition
message_1:
Solve the system of linear equations using Cholesky decomposition:

3x + 2y + 5z = 20 

2x + 7y + z = 29 

5x + z = 14 

Note: Cholesky decomposition is a matrix factorization method that represents a symmetric and positive-definite matrix as the product of a lower triangular matrix and its transpose.
message_2:
First, we need to represent the given system of linear equations as a matrix equation Ax = b, where A is the matrix of coefficients, x is the column vector of variables, and b is the column vector of constants.

A = | 3  2  5 |
    | 2  7  1 |
    | 5  0  1 |

b = | 20 |
    | 29 |
    | 14 |

Now, we will perform Cholesky decomposition on matrix A. We want to find a lower triangular matrix L such that A = LL^T.

L = | l11  0    0  |
    | l21  l22  0  |
    | l31  l32  l33|

Using the Cholesky decomposition formulas, we get:

l11 = sqrt(a11) = sqrt(3)
l21 = a21 / l11 = 2 / sqrt(3)
l31 = a31 / l11 = 5 / sqrt(3)

l22 = sqrt(a22 - l21^2) = sqrt(7 - (2 / sqrt(3))^2) = sqrt(19/3)
l32 = (a32 - l31 * l21) / l22 = (0 - (5 / sqrt(3)) * (2 / sqrt(3))) / sqrt(19/3) = -10 / sqrt(19/3)

l33 = sqrt(a33 - l31^2 - l32^2) = sqrt(1 - (5 / sqrt(3))^2 - (-10 / sqrt(19/3))^2) = sqrt(8/3)

So, the lower triangular matrix L is:

L = | sqrt(3)       0          0      |
    | 2/sqrt(3)  sqrt(19/3)    0      |
    | 5/sqrt(3)  -10/sqrt(19/3) sqrt(8/3)|

Now, we will solve the equation Ly = b for y:

| sqrt(3)       0          0      | | y1 |   | 20 |
| 2/sqrt(3)  sqrt(19/3)    0      | | y2 | = | 29 |
| 5/sqrt(3)  -10/sqrt(19/3) sqrt(8/3)| | y3 |   | 14 |

Solving this system, we get:

y1 = 20 / sqrt(3)
y2 = (29 - 2/sqrt(3) * y1) / sqrt(19/3) = 3
y3 = (14 - 5/sqrt(3) * y1 + 10/sqrt(19/3) * y2) / sqrt(8/3) = 2

Now, we will solve the equation L^T x = y for x:

|  sqrt(3)  2/sqrt(3)  5/sqrt(3)  | | x1 |   | 20/sqrt(3) |
|  0       sqrt(19/3) -10/sqrt(19/3)| | x2 | = |     3     |
|  0        0         sqrt(8/3)  | | x3 |   |     2     |

Solving this system, we get:

x1 = (20/sqrt(3)) / sqrt(3) = 20/3
x2 = (3 + 10/sqrt(19/3) * x3) / sqrt(19/3) = 1
x3 = 2 / sqrt(8/3) = 1

So, the solution to the given system of linear equations is:

x = 20/3
y = 1
z = 1
